pages.text: Throughout your journey, you will come across a lot of treasures. Many of them are locked which can be frustrating! $(br2)So this section will tell you which key is used for which lock. Pretty neat right?$()

pages.title: Key Ring!
pages.text: This is a pretty handy little thing. There is a limit to how much keys you can carry around with you on hand. This will significantly lower your inventory space usage. $(br2)A must-have for any treasure hunter!$()

pages.title: Modern Lock
pages.text: These days a lot of people use these locks because they are safe... That is a load of $(k)arse$(). Either use a modern lock pick or blow it up!

pages.title: Modern Lock Pick
pages.text: When using the modern lock pick, you have to hit the right tumblers in the right order. All locks are different in terms of length and sequence. $(br2)So keep a good amount on you when attempting to borrow whatever is within the locked chest.$()

pages.title: Wood Lock
pages.text: The cheapest lock ever created. Easiest to remove with a wooden key or a legacy crude lock pick. Usually the items within the locked chest isn't anything spectacular, but free stuff doesn't hurt nobody.

pages.title: Wood Key
pages.text: Easy to find and cheap to buy off of one those villagers. Forgot which profession... Not much to say here.

pages.title: Stone Lock
pages.text: Crude but it gets the job done. Someone in the ancient times didn't have much material to work with eh?

pages.title: Stone Key
pages.text: This civilization must have been desperate to make keys out of stone. Or didn't have any metal on them... $(br2)Don't expect too much of these chests.$()

pages.title: Iron Lock
pages.text: Now this is what you call a typical lock variant. Tried and true iron does the job. A classic.

pages.title: Iron Key
pages.text: OH! The cartographer villagers that sell these kinds of keys. You should check their trade stock if they sell any. Fingers crossed!

pages.title: Gold Lock
pages.text: Razlick said smelting these down to its source material is an insult to all craftmans over the world. $(br2)Well that still won't help you pay for last night's meal tab.

pages.title: Gold Key
pages.text: Ouuuhhhh shiny! You think you would smelt these down and make a good coin out of it. But NOOOOOOoooooooooo......

pages.title: Diamond Lock
pages.text: Who would have thought that diamonds and coal are similar in nature. So you wonder if they burn the same...

pages.title: Diamond Key
pages.text: Wow, got an earful from Caz for an experiment. Who knew throwing a coal and a diamond into a fire resulted in the same outcome.

pages.title: Emerald Lock
pages.text: Phyneks once said it used to belong to an ancient civilization of fairies and whatnot from many centuries ago. What a load of $(k)arse$()!

pages.title: Emerald Key
pages.text: Looks pretty though...

pages.title: Ruby Lock
pages.text: Bright as the red sun!

pages.title: Ruby Key
pages.text: Let it harness the heat of Nether's fiery hells!

pages.title: Sapphire Lock
pages.text: Mysterious as the blue moon!

pages.title: Sapphire Key
pages.text: Let it pierce the high heavens of the Aether!

pages.title: Spider Lock
pages.text: No, thank you.

pages.title: Spider Key
pages.text: This key is the worst thing in existance. Who made this design? $(br2)Vendrick likes the way they look and Min-Soo won't stop bothering people with them.$()

pages.title: Ember Lock
pages.text: Could be a lock to the chest's fiery heart!

pages.title: Ember Key
pages.text: Hot to the touch yet cool to look at!

pages.title: Leaf Lock
pages.text: Unable to burn it off. Almost destroyed an innocent chest for that experiment.

pages.title: Leaf Key
pages.text: It's flimsy as you would have imagined...

pages.title: Wither Lock
pages.text: Ugh, something unsettling about this lock. Definitely gives off a weird vibe. Might be something good inside though.

pages.title: Wither Key
pages.text: Made from a wither tree that you can find in the overworld. They are hard to miss and like to clump around in an area. $(br2)Smells very awful and breathing that air can kill you! Yuck!$()

pages.title: Jeweled Key
pages.text: You must be one pompous noble to be carrying this around your pocket. Either you have too much money to spend or nothing left to spend it on.

pages.title: Metallurgists Key
pages.text: RAZLICK! That's enough! All craftsman can go cry for all they want! $(br2)This looks awful, try a little bit harder next time!$()

pages.title: Lightning Key
pages.text: Lightning caught in a key. Make sure you make it strike!

pages.title: Skeleton Key
pages.text: Lady $(k)Morgana$() absolutely hates this key. Doesn't hurt to use it when needed. $(br2)Just don't tell her Grace...$()
